pr_title: [BEAM-9801] [cherry-pick] Pass in fire timestamp to timer callback

timeline.message:
[BEAM-9801] Pass in fire timestamp and pane info to timer callback

Pass in the timestamp to avoid:

[BEAM-9733] Repeatedly fire in batch mode until there are no more timers

timeline.bodyText:
Doesn't it make sense to make this change in batch as well for spark/flink in FlinkExecutableStageFunction and SparkExecutableStageFunction?
Any watermark based timers should continue to be eligible and continue to fire while in batch while the processing time timers should be dropped.
timeline.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: Good question. Spark basically does the same thing here (ideally this code should be shared..) @mxm
replies.author: ibzib

replies.bodyText: As expected, Spark is failing test_pardo_timers
replies.author: ibzib

replies.bodyText: This is a batch-only change. Streaming already flushes timers on close. I don't now whether dropping processing timers is correct. I think we should continue to fire them as well.
replies.author: mxm

replies.bodyText: I agree that the code could be shared with Spark. I initially thought about that when I pushed the fix in the other PR but got sidetracked..
replies.author: mxm

timeline.message: [BEAM-9733] Spark: Repeatedly fire in batch mode until there are no more timers
[BEAM-9733] Repeatedly fire in batch mode until there are no more timers
Merge pull request #11595: [BEAM-9801] Fire timers set within timers in Spark
[BEAM-9874] Support clearing timers in portable batch mode (Spark/Flink)
